definition: to have qualified successors to carry on one's undertaking
empress/queen/(archaic) monarch/ruler
back/behind/rear/afterwards/after/later/post-
surname Hou
to continue/to follow after/to go on with/to succeed/to inherit/then/afterwards
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: The tottering cause of Sichuan Opera seems to have successors.
sentences.chinese: 风雨飘摇中的川剧事业似乎后继有人。

sentences.english: The 16th Party Congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 党的十六大充分表明我们党兴旺发达，后继有人。

sentences.english: The 17th Party Congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 党的十七大充分表明我们党兴旺发达，后继有人。

sentences.english: The 12th Party congress fully demonstrates that our Party is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 党的十二大充分表明我们党兴旺发达，后继有人。

sentences.english: Education departments are required to provide successors in the field of scientific research.
sentences.chinese: 要后继有人，这是对教育部门提出的问题。

sentences.english: The 16th Party congress fully demonstrates that our Patty is flourishing and has no lack of successors.
sentences.chinese: 党的十六大充分表明我们党兴旺发达，后继有人。

definition: to have no qualified successors to carry on one's undertaking
lit. the color blue is made out of indigo but is more vivid than indigo (idiom)/fig. the student surpasses the master
pinyin: qing1 chu1 yu2 lan2 er2 sheng4 yu2 lan2

definition: to take up sb's mantle/to follow in sb's steps
to develop and promote/to carry forward/to bring to great height of development
the young will be redoubtable in the years to come (idiom)/the younger generations will surpass us in time
to teach/to impart/a disciple/descendant
the cassock and alms bowl of a Buddhist master passed on to the favorite disciple (Buddhism)/legacy/mantle
worthy of celebration/gratifying/Congratulations!
lit. the flame of a burning piece of firewood passes on to the rest (idiom)/fig. (of knowledge, skill etc) to be passed on from teachers to students, one generation to another
throughout the ages
lit. the rear waves of the Yangtze River drive on those before (idiom)/fig. the new is constantly replacing the old/each new generation excels the previous/(of things) to be constantly evolving
pinyin: Chang2 Jiang1 hou4 lang4 tui1 qian2 lang4

definition: to pass on (to future generations)/passed on (from former times)/a continued tradition/an inheritance
prosperous and developing/flourishing
lit. father a lion, son cannot be a dog (honorific); With a distinguished father such as you, the son is sure to do well./like father, like son
to have boundless prospects
treasure knife does not age (idiom); old but still vigorous
